name: Famous Lines Quiz | TV Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Columbo.

	Peter Falk, who played Colombo, has a glass eye. Columbo would say this in every episode after he would leave. He would return and say "Just one more thing..." and then proceed  to tell the person who committed the murder another clue he had.

Get Smart.

	Don Adams played Maxwell Smart (agent 86) whom was famous for this line.  Smart would say this to criminals when they had the upper hand. He would start with an extreme number "Would you believe this place is surrounded by 100 police men" to something such as "Okay would you believe it's surrounded by two boy scouts and their dog."

questions.text: "I don't have to take this, I'm going home."
questions.explanation:
Family Matters.

	"Family Matters" was a spin off of "Perfect Strangers".  Steve had a habit of annoying the Winslows.  They would eventually get so annoyed they'd yell "Steve go home! Go home! Go home!" Steve would reply "I don't have to take this, I'm going home."

Blossom.

	Joey Lawrence who made this line famous on "Blossom" started in the sitcom "Gimme a Break" when he was about four years old.

Bewitched.

	This line appeared in the first episode of "Bewitched" when she has to tell her husband that she's a little different than he is.

The Honeymooners.

	Ralph said this to Alice at the end of every episode. During the episodes he'd usually have gotten mad at Alice for something because he didn't have all the facts.  After learning he judged too quickly he would say "Baby you're the greatest" and then kiss her.

Dennis the Menace.

	Jay North played Dennis from 1959-1963.  Dennis yelled this all the time, usually scaring Mr. Wilson and making him drop or mess something up.

Dragnet.

	The stories on "Dragnet" were based on true stories, but the names were changed to protect the innocent as is stated in every episode.  Joe Friday would always tell people "Just the facts, Ma'am" when he was trying to get information to solve a crime.

The Flintstones.

	Dino talked in the very first episode of "The Flintstones".  Fred says this at the end of work when they let him leave the Quarry.  He also uses it when he is very excited about something.

The Price is Right.

	Bob Barker wasn't the first host of "The Price is Right". The first host was Bill Cullen.
